channel.title: Script stopping when its not needed to
channel.description:
Ok so i have a procedure it looks like this.
[code]Procedure MacroCheck; begin If(findbitmap(macro,x,y))then begin terminatescript end end;[/code]
The problem is that the script is terminitating when the bitmap isnt present

item.title: Script stopping when its not needed to
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

it should be like this

Procedure MacroCheck;
begin
If(findbitmap(macro,x,y))then
  terminatescript;
end;

that should work…

Read full topic
item.source: Script stopping when its not needed to

item.title: Script stopping when its not needed to
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

Perhaps your bitmap is bad? You might want to consider using FindBitmapIn, or better yet FindBitmapToleranceIn.

Read full topic

of course… us ea repeat until loop like

Procedure MacroCheck; begin repeat If(findbitmap(macro,x,y))then begin terminatescript end until false end;
